TopicTitle: Centre of mass and camera view changing in flight

Articles.Content: When I'm launching unmanned probes, I get a weird bug at about 5000m up, which causes the centre of mass to shift down and the vessel drifts out the camera view. When I rotate, it of course rotates around the new centre of mass, so it just shakes itself apart.

I've been having this problem today as well on one of my rockets, about every 6000m or so the camera tracks a new center of mass and eventually it drops BELOW the actual rocket so much that the rocket goes into a spin around this imaginary CoM.

It's very clear somethings up, because this kind of rocket shouldn't spin around a point below the rocket like a rock on a string......

Also I doubt it's a CoM issue in the rocket itself considering the Payload is a fuel tanker bound for my minmus Sci-Station and it's lander. If it was a problem with too much mass at the top it'd be spinning around the nose, not below the bottom engine.....

I'm on Windows so it doesn't appear to be a platform issue....

Do you have hotrockets installed? I checked my debug console and it came up with a hotrockets error as soon as the glitch started.
No, I don't have Hotrockets installed....
I am also having this issue, but in windows. Are your decouplers animating within VAB by any chance, TaintedLion?

I've seen this several times in the past, it's usually a mod (interfering with krakensbane?) causing the problem. Recently TweakableEverything had this issue with solar panels - toadicus is working on it.

Nobody has posted a list of installed mods, or any logs... so it's all guesswork.

Make a clean install and add one mod at a time until you trigger it, or do a binary sort on your mod list to save some time tracking it down.
